data.title: Remove unneeded space(lead to trailing space) when insert multi new lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version:
  OS X 10.11.2
  Steps to Reproduce:

If I have these
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2631733/14012046/09d6eaaa-f1de-11e5-9458-3b000bbe04e4.png)

Then I insert multi new lines. because Code auto indent, so I get multi trailing space.

The expected output is below
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2631733/14012125/ae2d9c98-f1de-11e5-9676-9f84d280bd7c.png)

In Sublime Text, if I insert multi new line, only current line will have trailing space. like this

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2631733/14012096/79ba8fb6-f1de-11e5-8785-5a12c90284db.png)

data.title: Gaps on the ruler when adding new lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 (0.10.11) [f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049]
- OS Version: El Capitan 10.11.3 (15D21)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set the editor settings to show ruler (in my case is 80)
2. Open a new window or file
3. Try adding a lot of new lines
4. There is a gap on the ruler

data.title: Error Extension host terminated unexpectedly. On first and subsequent startups.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider
- OS Version: Centos 7.2.1511 (Core)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Installed/unzipped to /opt/VSCode-linux-x64
2. dbl clicked code-insiders icon from Files app
3. after a few seconds the following error is dropped down in the code editor:
   
   Error Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover.

data.title: [c#] Builtin types not being highlighted in editor
sendFunctionBreakpoints send all functional breakpoint even when deactivated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set a few function breakpoints and source line breakpoints
2. Deactivate breakpoints from breakpoints window
3. debugger will receive "setBreakpoints" with an empty payload, which is expected
4. debugger will also receive "setFunctionBreakpoints" with non empty payload, debugger has no way to know the functional breakpoints are deactivated

DebugService.sendFunctionBreakpoints() should check areBreakpointsActivated()

data.title: Recommend Extensions only offering ESLint
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. F1 -> ext recommend
2. Shows only ESLint as recommended extensions, without having any extensions installed

If you install ESLint there are no recommendations given even though it is the only installed extension.

data.title: [json] provide intellisense for version in bower.json dependencies

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create Asp .net core empty project in visual studio.
2. Add some directories under wwwroot folder for client code like JS.
3. Add new item to manage client lib and add bower.json file.
4. Add some client side lib in to bower.json under dependency section like below:

> ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002399/19404f8e-f109-11e5-85fe-0b25c3b8b733.png)

Actual: Not getting intellisense for version #.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002646/7e2e6d58-f10a-11e5-9226-ab2c86dcef4d.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002621/5ec5c966-f10a-11e5-818b-b9ec5c42f49e.png)

data.title: Not getting intellisense in .html file for type and Src value.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create Asp .net core empty project in visual studio.
2. Add some directories under wwwroot folder for client code like JS.
3. Add new item to manage client lib and add bower.json file.
4. Add some client side lib in to bower.json under dependency section.

> ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002399/19404f8e-f109-11e5-85fe-0b25c3b8b733.png)
1. Add index.html under view folder and add basic html code like below and save changes.
   <!Doctype html>
   <html>
   <head>
   <title>Hello world</title>
   </head>
   <body>

</body>
</html>
6. Now launch VSCode and Open project folder.
7. Open index.html and try to add script section inside body.
<body>

<script type="text/javascript" src="JS/wwwroot/lib/angular/angular.js"></script>

</body>

Actual: Not getting any intellisense for
1. path for scr  like :
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002236/e6c67908-f107-11e5-9b33-3fc3bcb791ed.png)
1. Value for type like: "text/javascript"
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002230/dceac650-f107-11e5-892b-e57cc377d801.png)
2. closing script tag i.e. </script>
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14002111/f213d87e-f106-11e5-9cda-17a84c2355b5.png)

Expected: It should display values same like visual studio intellisense.

data.body:

data.title: Allow to drop folders into the explorer from the desktop to copy them

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder.
2. Try to drag and drop files and folders from windows explorer to VSCode explorer.

Actual: User able to move only files. For folder there is no action or error message.
Expected: If this feature is not supported then it should not show the Copy icon while performing drag and drop for folder. It should display some no action or invalid operation icon (how Visual studio is showing up) for drag and drop.

data.title: [python] Update on PTVS in VS Code?
data.body:
@smortaz mentioned on HackerNews last year that PTVS (Python Tools for Visual Studio) would be coming to VS Code this year (2016):

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=10589451

Is there perhaps any updates to the timeline? Or any updates you guys are able to share?

I did find another issue related to Python syntax highlighting in VS Code - but I assume this is unrelated to the effort to port PTVS to VS Code?

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2208

data.title: Full uninstall does not remove installed extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have some extensions installed
2. Uninstall VS Code
3. Delete VS Code %appdata% folder since it is not removed during uninstall
4. Re-install VS Code
5. Check installed extenstions

Actual:
There are left over installed extensions

Expected:
There are no installed extensions

data.title: Race condition between STOPPED and THREAD events in the debug service
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-insider / All
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04
- Debugging using Microsoft cpp debugger, but will happen in any "stop-all" style debugger. Note that this is an edge case, when a `STOPPED` event is sent by the debug adapter very close to a new thread creation. Also, this is not an immediate necessity. An April release fix is good.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile the following C++ code
   https://gist.github.com/edumunoz/80275bd231abb56165eb
   `g++ -g -std=c++11 -pthread vscode-repro.cpp -o vscode-repro`
2. Set a breakpoint in line 7 (the body of the test() function)
3. Start debugging. After hitting continue a couple of times, some of the threads won't have a callstack even if expanded.

In order to see it repro more clear, you can see the logging I added here https://github.com/edumunoz/vscode/commit/01a0e84d1b7bf613a027fd50764884de5e4c3192

```
[2438:0323/114759:INFO:CONSOLE(198)] "new thread has started 8", source: file:////home/edmunoz/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugService.js (198)
[2438:0323/114759:INFO:CONSOLE(169)] "Recevied stopped event. The considered threads are  1 5 7", source: file:////home/edmunoz/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugService.js (169)
[2438:0323/114759:INFO:CONSOLE(200)] "now received the info about the new thread 8", source: file:////home/edmunoz/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugService.js (200)
```

The debug adapter is sending the `THREAD` event before the `STOPPED` event (which is correct). However, since the `DebugService` queries the debug adapter for all the threads after getting a `started thread` event, there is a race condition between `STOPPED` and `THREAD`.

The result of this race condition is that, since by default threads are created with `stopped = false`, VSCode doesn't query for the `callstack` of those threads when calling `getChildren` on the `CallStackDataSource`.

/cc @isidorn @weinand @delmyers

data.title: Fonts are rendered with periodic subpixel blurring instead of being pixel-hinted

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64 SP1

Initially I commented about it in #2043, but I guess it's worth opening a new issue.

Something is wrong with font rendering in VS Code, font widths seem to be fractional or hinting is not respected (I might be using the wrong term). Compare these renderings of the same string in Visual Studio 2015 and in VS Code:

![renderings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14021464/13882491/af7a64de-ed36-11e5-8628-93249701f326.png)
Notice how vertical elements periodically loose pixel hintning and become blurry and then sharp again, and that VS Code renders the sample string one pixel shorter than VS2015.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set some strongly hinted font (I use Envy Code R) in settings.json
2. Type any string long enough to see vertical lines of symbols becoming progressively blurrier.

data.title: Installing extensions does not report progress
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install a big extension that is likely to take some time
2. Navigate away from VS Code and come back
3. No progress bar/indication if the extension is installing
#3341 deals with something similar to this but only a message was added as part of 83f1fe7f20b7c099246a8a8d62fd829bbf6d4840

data.title: Syntax highlighting in Typescript not handling identifiers that start with var correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511

Steps to Reproduce:

In a typescript file, have 

``` javascript
let varName = "";
varName = "a";
```

The issue is that the 'var' substring in `varName` is highlighted the way the `var` construct would ordinarily be.

data.title: ⌘-key combos no longer work with alternate keyboard layout (eg Dvorak)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 (f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In System Preferences -> Keyboard, switch to something other than US english
2. Try to change zoom level with ⌘-+ or open settings file with ⌘-,

In earlier release of VSCode, this worked. Did you switch from reading OS-mapped keypress to raw scancodes for input? Maybe a Chromium or Electron bug?

data.title: vscode.startDebug should take debug configuration json as argument

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hello,

This request is related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4607.

I need to be able to start the debugger using a configuration with a specific name.
For now, vscode can only launch the default or selected configuration.

I hope you will take my request into consideration and it will enhance vscode.

Thanks in advance for your feedback.

data.title: Cannot read property 'dispose' of undefined (fixes #4573)
data.body: @isidorn can you please code review?

data.title: Schema for locale.json
data.body:
Provide a schema for `locale.json`, that way the user experience will be nicer when he wants to input a language and might not know the shortcut.
I think this will especailly help since there is confusion between 2 and 3 letter language accronyms, eg DE or DEU
